contentrichtext.text: [[Image:20100922 hyundai sonata police car 1.jpg|250px|thumb|[[Hyundai]] [[Hyundai Sonata|Sonata]] police car in South Korea.]] [[South Korea]] has a relatively unified and integrated approach to [[law enforcement]]. For example, the [[National Police Agency (Republic of Korea)|National Police Agency]] provides all policing services throughout the country. This differs from the situation in many countries such as [[France]], where policing is split between the [[Police Nationale|National Police]] and ''[[French Gendarmerie|Gendarmerie]]'', or such as the [[United States]] which have a layered system of national, state/regional and/or local law enforcement organizations. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Historical secret police organizations== *[[National Intelligence Service (South Korea)|Korea Central Intelligence Agency]] (KCIA) *[[National Intelligence Service (South Korea)|Agency for National Security Planning]] (ANSP) ==See also== *[[Government of South Korea]] *[[List of government agencies of South Korea]] *[[National Police Agency (South Korea)]] (NPA) *[[Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency]] (SMPA) *[[Korea Coast Guard]] (KCG) == External links == *[http://www.npa.go.kr/ KNPA Official website] *[http://www.smpa.go.kr/ SMPA Official website] *http://www.photius.com/countries/korea_south/national_security/korea_south_national_security_korean_national_poli~253.html *http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/faculty/rwinslow/asia_pacific/south_korea.html *http://www.ahrchk.net/statements/mainfile.php/2005statements/378/ *http://www.hartford-hwp.com/archives/55a/309.html *http://www.pww.org/past-weeks-2001/Workers%20across%20South%20Korea%20demonstrate.htm {{Asia topic|Law enforcement in}} [[Category:Law enforcement in South Korea]] {{law-enforcement-stub}}
